item.title: India registers 'strong protest' with Dhaka over remarks by Bangladesh leader - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India Protests Against Bangladesh Leader's Controversial Remarks

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) of India has lodged a strong protest with the Bangladeshi government over remarks made by Mahfuj Alam, a key aide of the interim government of Bangladesh. Officials emphasized the need for responsible public comments from leaders.

  • India's MEA expressed concern over controversial statements made by a Bangladeshi government aide.
  • Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal reiterated India's interest in fostering relations with Bangladesh.
  • The Bangladeshi aide's Facebook post, which has since been deleted, claimed India should recognize a recent political upheaval in Bangladesh.
  • Recent violence against minorities in Bangladesh has raised concerns for India.
“We have registered our strong protest on this issue with the Bangladesh side. We would like to remind all concerned to be mindful of their public comments.” - Randhir Jaiswal

This incident highlights the sensitive nature of India-Bangladesh relations and the potential for diplomatic tensions arising from public remarks by officials.

item.title: Moderate drinkers may live longer than teetotalers, claims a study - The Times of India
item.description:
Moderate drinkers may live longer than teetotalers, claims a study

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

This article discusses a study that suggests moderate drinkers may have a longer lifespan compared to those who abstain from alcohol entirely.

  • The study analyzes various health outcomes related to alcohol consumption.
  • Moderate drinking is defined as one to two drinks per day.
  • Researchers found significant differences in longevity between moderate drinkers and teetotalers.
"The evidence is accumulating that moderate drinking can be beneficial for health, particularly in terms of longevity."

In conclusion, the study presents compelling evidence that moderate alcohol consumption may have advantages for longevity, though further research is needed to explore the underlying factors.

item.title: Descendants of Aurangzeb riding rickshaws in Kolkata: UP CM Yogi Adityanath continues tirade against 'temple destroyers' - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Yogi Adityanath's Remarks on Aurangzeb's Descendants in Kolkata

Published: 20 December 2024, 10:56 IST

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has made controversial remarks regarding the descendants of those who destroyed Hindu temples, claiming they now struggle in Kolkata.

  • Adityanath stated that the clan responsible for temple destruction, including by Mughal rulers like Aurangzeb, would become 'extinct'.
  • He mentioned that those connected to temple desecration currently ply rickshaws near Kolkata.
  • His comments come amid rising tensions following significant communal violence in Sambhal.
  • He emphasized the need to protect Sanatan Dharma to safeguard humanity.
“Their clan will be extinct… only Sanatan Dharma can establish peace in the world.”

Adityanath's comments reflect ongoing communal tensions and evoke historical grievances regarding Hindu temples destroyed during Mughal rule.

item.title: ‘Seniors complained about Prithvi Shaw. He stayed out all night, reached hotel at 6 AM’: Selectors rubbish Insta rant - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Selectors Respond to Prithvi Shaw's Instagram Rant About Team Exclusion

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The ongoing turmoil surrounding Prithvi Shaw's cricket career intensifies as he has been excluded from Mumbai's squad for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy following complaints about his fitness and discipline from team officials.

  • Prithvi Shaw's Instagram post criticized his exclusion and highlighted his batting statistics.
  • Mumbai officials express concern over Shaw's fitness, citing his poor performance in the field during previous matches.
  • A senior official stated, "No one is Shaw's enemy. He is his own enemy," reflecting the sentiment within the Mumbai Cricket Association.
  • Shaw's habit of arriving late to training sessions has drawn criticism from teammates.
  • Mumbai's campaign begins with a match against Karnataka at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel B Ground.
"Even the seniors in the team have started complaining about his attitude now."

The ongoing scrutiny of Shaw's performance and behavior raises questions about his future in cricket as he must address his fitness and discipline to reclaim his place in the team.

item.title: Atul Subhash's Mother Goes To Supreme Court For 4-Year-Old Grandson's Custody - NDTV
item.description:
Atul Subhash's Mother Goes To Supreme Court For 4-Year-Old Grandson's Custody

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a poignant development, the mother of Atul Subhash, a Bengaluru engineer who died by suicide, has approached the Supreme Court for custody of her four-year-old grandson amidst allegations of harassment against Subhash's estranged wife and her family.

  • The case revolves around multiple arrests linked to Subhash's suicide on December 9, which his family claims was prompted by harassment.
  • Anju Modi filed a habeas corpus petition for her grandson, whose whereabouts remain unknown despite claims he is in a boarding school.
  • The Supreme Court has asked the governments of Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and Karnataka for clarity regarding the child’s location.
  • Nikita Singhania, Subhash's estranged wife, and her family members face charges related to abetment of suicide and are currently in custody.
  • Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father, demands to know the child's whereabouts and custody due to the family's concerns for his safety.
  • There is ongoing legal contention, including anticipatory bail requests concerning Nikita's uncle.
Bikas Kumar, Subhash's brother, stated, "Our fight will continue. We will not immerse the ashes of my brother till we get justice."

The situation highlights serious familial disputes and legal battles regarding the welfare of a young child amidst tragic circumstances.

item.title: SpaceX to Launch Two Private Lunar Landers in January 2025 - Gadgets 360
item.description:
SpaceX to Launch Two Private Lunar Landers in January 2025

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Gadgets 360

Two private lunar landers are set to be launched aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket in January 2025, marking a milestone in lunar exploration.

  • The landers, from Firefly Aerospace and ispace, will launch from Florida's Space Coast.
  • ispace's ‘Resilience’ aims to land on Mare Frigoris, carrying five payloads including a water electrolyser.
  • Firefly's ‘Blue Ghost’ will land at Mare Crisium and deliver ten science instruments under NASA's program.
  • If successful, these missions will add to the achievements of private lunar landers.
“If successful, these missions will join the limited achievements of private companies in lunar landings,” said a space expert.

The upcoming launch solidifies international interest in lunar exploration and could foster future collaborative missions.

item.title: FIR filed against CT Ravi, will be presented before court: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIR Filed Against BJP Leader CT Ravi Over Allegations of Derogatory Remarks

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara announced that an FIR has been filed against BJP leader CT Ravi after he allegedly made derogatory remarks towards Congress Leader Laxmi Hebbalkar. Ravi is set to be presented before the court following these accusations.

  • An FIR was filed against CT Ravi after he allegedly used obscene language towards Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar.
  • G Parameshwara affirmed that CT Ravi will be presented in court today.
  • The incident escalated after CT Ravi reportedly called Rahul Gandhi a drug addict.
  • Advocate MB Jiragi claimed that formal arrest procedures were not followed for CT Ravi.
“This incident all started after he allegedly called Rahul Gandhi a drug addict. It is wrong, being a senior politician no one should use such words, that too against a lady who is a minister.”

This situation raises concerns regarding the treatment of political figures and the respect accorded to political discourse in Karnataka.

item.title: 'Singham Again' OTT release: Here's when and where to watch the Ajay Devgn, Akshay Kumar, Ranveer Singh, - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Singham Again OTT release: Here's when and where to watch the Ajay Devgn, Akshay Kumar, Ranveer Singh, Deepika Padukone, Kareena Kapoor Khan, Arjun Kapoor starrer!

Publication Date: November 1, 2023 | Source: Times of India

'Singham Again', featuring a star-studded cast, is now available to watch on OTT after a successful theatrical run.

  • The film clashed with 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' at the box office during Diwali.
  • It grossed around Rs 247 crore net in India.
  • Available for rent on Amazon Prime for Rs 499, but not included with Prime subscription yet.
  • Full availability expected after January 1, 2025.
  • Includes extended cameos from Akshay Kumar, Ranveer Singh, and Deepika Padukone.
'Singham Again' is touted to have a standalone film for Deepika Padukone's character, Shakti Shetty, in the future.

The film's OTT release allows fans who missed it in theaters to enjoy a solid Bollywood action flick from home.

item.title: Huawei beats Apple, dominates wrist-worn device market for most of 2024: IDC - The Indian Express
item.description:
Huawei Beats Apple to Lead Global Wrist-Worn Device Market in 2024

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The wrist-worn device market sees a significant shift as Huawei overtakes Apple to secure the top position for the first three quarters of 2024, driven by robust sales of its GT5 series and blood pressure monitor.

  • Huawei has surpassed Apple in the wrist-worn wearable market for the first three quarters of 2024.
  • The top-selling products include Huawei's GT5, GT5 Pro, and Watch D2, contributing to sales growth across various regions.
  • Apple briefly regained the top spot with the Watch Series 10 but faces challenges in innovation.
  • Xiaomi holds third place with significant growth attributed to the Xiaomi Band 9 and Watch S series.
  • China is the largest market for wrist-worn devices, with 45.8 million units shipped and a 20.1% growth year-over-year.
  • Sales in India and the United States have declined compared to the previous year.
“Huawei has managed to outpace Apple in the wrist-worn device segment.”

This trend highlights Huawei's increasing dominance in the wearable market, emphasizing the need for innovation among competitors like Apple to retain market share.

item.title: Former Haryana CM, INLD chief Om Prakash Chautala passes away - The Indian Express
item.description:
Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala Passes Away at 89

Publication Date: Friday, December 15, 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

Former Haryana chief minister and Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) leader Om Prakash Chautala passed away at his Gurugram residence on Friday afternoon. He was 89 years old.

  • Chautala served as the chief minister of Haryana for a record five terms.
  • He was the son of former deputy prime minister Devi Lal.
  • Chautala will be cremated in Teja Khera, Sirsa district, with public viewings scheduled for Saturday.
  • He is survived by two sons and three daughters, with his son Dushyant having served as Deputy Chief Minister of Haryana.
  • Chautala had faced legal troubles, having been convicted in a 2013 corruption case, which affected his political career significantly.
“A cardiac arrest took his life as he had hiccups before he took his last breath,” said INLD spokesperson Rakesh Sihag.

Om Prakash Chautala's passing marks the loss of a significant figure in Haryana's political landscape, having attempted to forge a new political front after his release from jail.

item.title: Washington Sundar, blamed for taking R Ashwin's spot, gave 'best' 2-minute speech on India legend's retirement night - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Washington Sundar, blamed for taking R Ashwin's spot, gave 'best' 2-minute speech on India legend's retirement night

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The retirement of Indian cricket legend Ravichandran Ashwin has sparked numerous tributes from teammates, including a heartfelt message from Washington Sundar, who has often been seen as Ashwin's successor.

  • Sundar praised Ashwin for his mentorship and support throughout his career.
  • Ashwin announced his retirement after a stellar career with 765 wickets.
  • In a tribute, Ashwin remarked on Sundar's two-minute speech during the retirement celebration.
  • Sundar is expected to fill Ashwin's role in upcoming matches, starting with the Boxing Day Test.
Ashwin’s response to Sundar: “Thupakkiya pudinga washiii! The 2 minutes you spoke that night in the get together was the best.”

This moment highlights the strong bond between the two spinners and sets the stage for Sundar as he steps into Ashwin's shoes.

item.title: Indian-origin illegal immigrant jailed for nearly 5 years as lie unravels in UK Wickes worker assault case - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin illegal immigrant jailed for nearly 5 years in UK assault case

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Karandeep Singh, an Indian national without legal status in the UK, was sentenced to nearly five years in prison for assaulting a hardware store employee during a robbery attempt.

  • Singh was involved in a violent attack on a Wickes employee in Slough, Berkshire, in May 2023.
  • Initially claiming to be 18 years old, he faced court after failing to attend his trial.
  • The assault resulted in a 9cm head wound for the victim, who subsequently feared returning to work.
  • Singh lied about his age, revealing conflicting information about his identity and background during the court proceedings.
  • He was convicted on robbery and grievous bodily harm charges, receiving a sentence of four years, eight months, and 14 days.
“He does have three alias birthdays on the Police National Computer and he looks to me a little bit older than 19” - Judge Sarah Jane Campbell.

Singh’s case reflects broader issues of immigration status and crime, raising questions about legal accountability and the treatment of immigrants in the UK.

item.title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700 - The Times of India
item.description:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700

Date: Today
Source: Times of India

Indian equity benchmark indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 faced significant declines today, dipping below 78,500 and just above 23,700 respectively. Key factors include recent comments from the US Federal Reserve affecting investor confidence.

  • BSE Sensex declined by 836 points (1.06%) to 78,382.17.
  • Nifty50 dropped by 241 points (1.01%) to 23,710.95.
  • Foreign investors sold shares worth 122.31 billion rupees ($1.44 billion) this week.
  • Weekly declines of both indices exceed 3%, marking the first drop after four weeks of gains.
  • Top gainers included Asian Paints, Nestle India, and Titan Company, while major losers were Tech Mahindra and Axis Bank.
“Despite the weakness, oversold conditions and resilience in select pockets present buying opportunities.” - Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking

In conclusion, the current pressure on the stock market can be attributed to global economic conditions, particularly the US Federal Reserve's recent statements on interest rates, prompting caution among investors.

item.title: Aishwarya Rai-Abhishek Bachchan squash divorce rumours; proudly record Aaradhya’s annual day performance with AbRam - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Aishwarya Rai-Abhishek Bachchan squash divorce rumours; proudly record Aaradhya’s annual day performance with AbRam

Date: Dec 20, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan recently dispelled divorce rumors by attending their daughter Aaradhya's annual day event together, delighting their fans.

  • The couple has been the subject of divorce speculation following a July social media post.
  • They were seen smiling together at the Dhirubhai Ambani School event, supporting their daughter.
  • Abhishek gained praise for helping Aishwarya with her outfit.
  • Videos of their attendance went viral, leading fans to defend them against trolls.
“Whatever it is, Aishwarya is a very good woman and respects her husband's family and traditions!”

This public display of unity has resonated well with fans, many of whom are relieved to see the couple together again.

item.title: Severe Case Of Bird Flu In The US; Here's What You Should Know - NDTV
item.description:
Severe Case Of Bird Flu In The US; Here's What You Should Know

Publication Date: Wednesday, 2024
Source: CDC

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has reported a severe avian influenza infection case in Louisiana, marking the first serious human case in the U.S., bringing the total to 61 infections in the current outbreak.

  • The patient had contact with sick and dead birds.
  • The H5N1 virus was identified with genetic sequencing.
  • Current risk to the public is considered low.
  • Symptoms of bird flu in humans include high fever, severe coughing, and breathing difficulties.
  • Preventive measures include avoiding contact with infected birds and practicing good hygiene.
“This case highlights that wild birds and backyard flocks, along with commercial poultry and dairy operations, can also be sources of infection.” - CDC

It is essential to follow prevention tips to reduce the risk of infection while remaining vigilant for symptoms.
